name: Haas Experimental 1.2
description: My first corp deck. For use in  a friendly environment :)

name: Discounted runs
description:
First I saw this post on bgg http://boardgamegeek.com/thread/1076656/deck-the-powerful-mac-five-plugged-in-san-rafael-w

I liked the idea of building an efficient core rig. But it takes time and make the runner spend a lot of ressources on breaking subs.
With that in mind, I decided to find a way to lower the cash needed for such a rig while keeping the possibility for early pressure.
Hostage is here for multiple reasons, the first being all the ressources we need are connections and the second it trades influence for deckspace that we use on hardware. With that many, you want Inside Man ASAP, period. This is definitely your first hostage play if you don't have it in hand.
The second card you're looking for is Replicator. While not being mandatory for the deck to work, it will boost your installation so much you will want it each game. Diesel is here to help you on that quest.
Tinkering and Stimhack are here for early aggression. While installing your hardwares and programs you have Deus X/Faerie to fight big ices, Snare! and the like.
You want at least 2 Cyberfeeder, 1-2 Cloak and Corroder or Guardian Blade on Omni-Drive for a total of 5 free credits to use in one turn. Avoid installing more than 2 Cloak for MU issues unless you have preemptively installed all your MU cards (7 total).
I decided not to play The Toolbox to avoid problem with cash as I have no way to gain them back quikly.
The installation of hardwares and programs is very dependant on the cost. Try to use Kate ability properly, in addition to Inside Man/Modded.

As the game progress, you will be able to do at least a discounted run a turn and that is when John Masanori and Kati Jones should be installed. While competing for the last Agenda Points, you should find them in R&D using the interfaces.

name: Chaos Central
description:
This just has soo many bits to put in place it's only won one game so far. But I like the toys.
The practice is to open with either SMC or Test run for Ninja or Opus.
If Ninja, start running, if Opus start building. Dig for Replicator & Dino.

Not sure which direction to take it with Opening Moves & Second Thoughts.

name: Chaos Theory 'Riding the Wave'
description:
Runner deck that has great ways to kickstart into the game, but really uses all the Shaper tricks to make sure there's always something up your sleeve. Feels like riding a wave of momentum. Great when on your high, but watch out that you don't run out of steam too early!

Strong events, coupled with some Event recursion, made possible because you can grab the program you need the most with Self-Modifying code, and Clone Chip.

name: Jinteki Invasion
description: Another idea to work in my current favorite card. IoP is essentially unavoidable damage. With shaper and criminal being the most common meta (OK...mostly criminal) this operation just hurts them badly. Maybe giving you enough time to advance an agenda. The idea is to hurt them but if you get lucky and trash everything a neural Welp can flat line them.
